snippet: The latest civilian casualties in eastern Afghanistan added to a particularly deadly week of fighting.
abstract: American military airstrike in eastern Afghanistan near Pakistan border is reported to have killed 18 people, including at least one senior Taliban commander but also women and children, raising thorny issue of civilian casualties for third time in roughly a week.

byline.contributor: Sangar Rahimi and Habib Zahori contributed reporting from Kabul, and Michael R. Gordon from Istanbul.

lead_paragraph: The latest civilian casualties in eastern Afghanistan added to a particularly deadly week of fighting.

headline.seo: Children Killed in U.S. Strike on Taliban Commander
headline.main: Afghan Children Reported Among Dead in U.S. Strike
headline.print_headline: Afghan Children Reported Among Dead in U.S. Strike

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
